author.name: Sam Turnbull • It Doesn't Taste Like Chicken

description: Have a fajita party in your own home. This quick and easy vegan fajita recipe can be customized however you like with endless topping options. Serve the sizzling skillet directly to the table with all the sides and everyone can make their own fajitas to their own tastes preferences. A great summer meal for family or dinner parties.

mentions.description: Bean is a common name for large seeds of several genera of the flowering plant family Fabaceae (also known as Leguminosae) which are used for human or animal food.
mentions.name: bean

name: Mixed Vegetables Fajitas
recipeIngredient: 4 bell peppers (red, yellow, orange, green, your choice!), (thickly sliced)
1 red, white, or yellow onion, (thickly sliced)
2 tablespoons light oil, (such as vegetable or canola)
Refried beans (check to make sure they are vegan)
Melty Stretchy Gooey Vegan Nacho Cheese
Sour Cream of my Dreams (page 207 in Fuss-Free Vegan)

recipeInstructions.text: Method 1: Heat your oven to 350F (180C). Wrap the tortillas in aluminium foil, and pop them in the oven for 15-20 minutes until heated through.

Method 2: If you have a gas stove, turn on a flam and using tongs put a tortilla directly over the flame. Turn continually to evenly toast the tortilla, flip and repeat on the other side. About 20 seconds per side. Repeat with the remaining tortillas.

video.name: Vegan Fajitas Recipe - Easy Sizzling Vegetable Fajitas!.mp4
